a.style: font-family:'Playfair Display', Georgia, 'Times New Roman', 'Liberation Serif', serif

text.tspan: Carbon intensity vs. GDP per capita, 2022
Carbon intensity represents the quantity of CO₂ emitted per unit of energy consumption – it's measured in
kilograms of CO₂ emitted per kilowatt-hour of energy.
Data source: Global Carbon Budget (2024) and other sources
Note: GDP per capita is measured in constant international-$ which corrects for inflation and cross-country price differences.
